common.key.tips: Key can only contain letters, numbers, '.', '_' or '-'.
common.diff.tips: The following is a before and after comparison of this change.
sidebar.modal.title: Are you sure to leave this page?
login.password.tips: Password can only contain letters, numbers, '.', '_' or '-'.
login.error.text: Account or password is incorrect, please retry!
login.demo.password.tip: The demo environment login do not check password, the Open Source version supports password checking.
members.role.tips: After the role is changed, the member needs to log out and sign in again to make the new role effective.
members.create.error.text: Error, account was not created, please retry!
members.update.error.text: Error, account was not updated, please retry!
members.delete.error.text: Error, account was not deleted, please retry!
members.delete.modal.title: Are you sure?
members.delete.modal.content: this user is going to be deleted
members.owner.auth.text: can read and write all contents of the tenant.
members.writer.auth.text: can read and write toggles in this tenant, but cannot change project, environment, and account.
profile.password.not.match: Password confirmation doesn't match the new password
profile.password.update.error.text: Error, password was not updated, please retry!
projects.delete.title: Are you sure to delete this project?
projects.delete.content: The project and the environments in the project will be permanently deleted.
projects.cannot.delete.title: Can not delete
projects.environment.archive.title: Are you sure to archive this environment?
projects.environment.archive.content: The toggles in this environment will be archived together.
projects.environment.restore.title: Are you sure to restore this environment?
projects.environment.restore.content: Toggles in this environment will be restored together.
projects.environment.crete.copyEnvPlaceh: Please select an environment to copy
projects.environment.crete.copyEnvTips: Toggles in this environment will be copied to a new environment.
projects.description: Projects are collections of toggles, project can have multiple environments like production, stage, dev etc. We recommend creating one project for each service (microservice).
toggles.key.tips: Use this key in your code. Cannot be changed after creation.
toggles.sdk.tips: If the toggle will use the client SDK later, please select “yes”, which determines the type of language used to access the SDK. Cannot be changed after creation.
toggles.returntype.tips: Return types decide the toggle's return type in your code. Cannot be changed after creation.
toggles.variations.tips: Variations decide the toggle's return information in your code.
toggles.disabled.return.type.tips: Define the return variation when toggle is disabled.
toggles.edit.tips: The following changes will take effect in all environments of this project.
toggles.archive.title: Are you sure to archive this toggle?
toggles.archive.content: The toggle will be archived in all environments.
toggles.restore.title: Are you sure to restore this toggle?
toggles.restore.content: The toggle will be restored in all environments.
toggles.permanent.type.tips: FeatureProbe cares a lot about code quality, and technical debt builds up over time. The non-"permanent" toggle cycle is is 30 days, and we will prompt you to clean it up in time. If you want to keep it in your code as a long-term toggle, you can mark it as a "permanent" toggle and we won't prompt you to clean it up.
toggles.permanent.tips: This toggle is temporary and has been used for {useDays} days. It is recommended to clean it in time!
toggles.description: Toggle belongs to a project, and when a toggle is created, it appears in all environments of the project.
toggles.settings.tips: Set approval strategy for environments. The strategy will affect all toggle publishing in this environment.
toggles.settings.approval.enable.tips: The environment has toggles in the approval process that are not allowed to be turned off
targeting.default.rule.tips: Define the return variation when no rule is matched.
targeting.disabled.return.value.tips: Define the return variation when toggle is disabled.
targeting.rules.tips: Serve a variation to specific users based on their attributes
targeting.page.leave.text: Unsaved changes will be lost, are you sure to leave?
targeting.publish.modal.title: Are you sure to publish?
targeting.publish.tips: The metric data is being collected, and the toggle change may affect the accuracy of the results.
targeting.publish.start.collect: The collection of analysis data is currently not started. Do you want to start data collection at the same time?
targeting.traffic.desc: After the SDK is successfully connected, you can observe the changes of the access data at any time, and perceive the impact of the version change on the access data.
targeting.rule.delete.text: Are you sure to delete this rule?
targeting.serve.percentage.error.text: {value}% needs to be assigned to a variation
targeting.size.tips: The total content of this page can not exceed 1 M, and will not be released normally when it is larger than 1 M. Currently, it has reached {size} KB!
targeting.size.tips.title: Warning Tips
targeting.edit.tips: The metric data is being collected, and changes other than the name and description may affect the accuracy of the analysis results.
targeting.approval.tips: Owner can set approval reviewers for this environment.
variations.duplicated.error.text: Variation names are duplicated, please change!
segments.modal.delete.title: Are you sure to delete this segment?
segments.modal.cannot.delete.title: Can not delete
segments.modal.cannot.delete.text: This segment is used by {count} toggles, can not delete
segments.modal.delete.tips: This change will take effect in {count} toggles
segments.delete.error: Error, segment was not deleted, please retry!
segments.card.tips: Commonly used target rules can be set up as segment, which can be shared between toggles.

platform.warning.text: According to the Cybersecurity Law, it is prohibited to use FeatureProbe for illegal financial lending, cryptocurrency, gambling and any applications containing Telemarketing Scams functions, once discovered, you will be immediately stopped from using FeatureProbe and reported to the Cyber Security Department.
approvals.table.header.title: Title
guide.global.step1.title: Project
guide.global.step1.project: Manage the [project] and the [environments] information of the project
guide.global.step1.env: Quickly copy the [environment key] for SDK initialization
guide.global.step1.enter: Switch the entry for viewing the toggles of different projects
guide.global.step2.title: Switch environment
guide.global.step2.env: Click to switch the environment and view the toggles information in different environments
guide.global.step3.title: Segment
guide.creat.toggle.step1.title: Client SDK
guide.creat.toggle.step1.sdk1: If client SDK will be used in this toggle later, please select [Yes]
guide.creat.toggle.step2.title: Return Type
guide.creat.toggle.step2.type1: [Return Type] determines the type of toggle return value that can be read in the code corresponding to the toggle
guide.creat.toggle.step2.type2: After the toggle is created, it cannot be changed
guide.creat.toggle.step3.type: Return variation when the toggle is disabled
guide.toggle.targeting.step1.title: Click to switch toggle status
guide.toggle.targeting.step1.off: Disabled status, the return variation depends on the [When toggle is disabled]
guide.toggle.targeting.step1.on: Enabled status, the return variation depends on the [Rules] and [Default Rule] below
guide.toggle.targeting.step2.title: Set the default return variation
guide.toggle.targeting.step2.default: If all the above [rules] of a user fail to hit, the [default return variation] will be returned
guide.project.step1.title: Environment
guide.project.step1.content1: A project supports multiple environments, generally including online environment, test environment, development environment, etc
guide.project.step1.content2: All environments contain all toggles under the project, but the settings of toggles in each environment are usually different
guide.project.step2.title: Environment SDK key
guide.project.step2.content1: Quickly copy the environment “SDK Key” for SDK initialization
webhook.url.normal.text: We’ll send a POST request to the URL with details of events.
webhook.delete.tips.title: Tips
webhook.delete.tips.content: Are you sure to delete this webhook?
webhook.duplicated.urls: Detected that there are currently existing webhooks for the same URL:
webhook.secretkey.tips: A method for webhook authentication. Use the 'secret key' to generate a request signature for authentication to prevent URLs from being maliciously requested.
webhook.description: Support for subscribing to platform events, such as toggle changes, user changes, and more.
token.application.title: Shared access tokens
token.personal.title: Personal access tokens
token.delete.tips.title: Sure to delete this token?
token.delete.tips.content: Token will be invalid after deleted.
token.created.modal.title: {name} created
token.copy.tips: Copy and save this token now. You won't be able to see it again!
token.card.application.description: The lifetime of a shared token is not bounded with its creator. You must delete the token to make it invalid.
token.card.personal.description: A personal API token has the same access privileges as its creator. If its creator is removed, the token will be invalidated immediately.
analysis.event.name: Event name
analysis.event.name.tip: Use this event name when reporting in code. Name can only contain letters, numbers, '.', '_' or '-'.
analysis.event.conversion.desc: Track when user take an action
analysis.event.numeric.desc: Track value changes against a baseline
analysis.event.click.target.tips: CSS selectors are patterns used to select the element(s).
analysis.result.tip: Create a metric to use analysis.
analysis.result.collect.tip: This operation will clear the analysis data and restart the calculation.
analysis.result.table.name: Variation
